_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Engine Room detector tied to emergency ventilation
_prev_prog_3.Description: Prevention planning consists of preventive maintenance that is tracked on an automated maintenance management program.  This automatically generates work orders to ensure PM's are completed on a timely basis.  We adhere to Process Safety Management and provide training to operators that includes classroom, on the job and testing.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Cargill Kitchen Solutions policy is to comply with all applicable laws and regulations; champion waste reduction, energy conservation, and protection of the environment in the communities where we have a presence.  Management recognizes that leadership in environmental protection is critical to all of our stakeholders, customers and communities in which we do business.  We meet or exceed all federal, state and local standards in the operation of our plant.  Our core purpose is to be the supplier of choice for customers worldwide.  Our stakeholders produce value added egg products utilizing liquid egg in either whole, white or yolk form.  Anhydrous Ammonia is used in our refrigeration system to maintain and control temperatures of our manufacturing processes.  This ensures that our products are processed and maintained at proper temperatures to inhibit microbiological growth.   Our refrigeration system was recently upgraded and combined 2 systems into one referred to as the "South Side" Refrigeration system.

We comply with OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM), OSHA Emergency Action Plan, Emergency Response, EPA Oil Spill Prevention Countermeasure and Control plan and applicable EPCRA regulations at state and local levels.

We have a Non-Responding Emergency Response plan that is coordinated with the Wright County Special Response Unit (WCSRU) that has achieved state HAZMAT response certification. Tours/drills/training are conducted on a regular basis.  We also review with the fire dept. and the WCSRU the key points to know about a refrigeration system and invite them to drill at our facility.  Evacuation drills are held on a regular basis with all stakeholders.  These drills are critiqued and any deficiencies are reviewed and appropriate corrective action taken. 

Preventive Maintenance is tracked on a computer maintenance management system.  This is allowing us to build trend history in an organized manner and allowing us to become predictive vs. preventive in our

maintenance and further ensuring safe operation of our systems.  Management of Change and Pre Start Safety review are principles from PSM that are being deployed to all of our process lines to ensure safe operation and design.  Contractors are required to submit information on their safety programs and if standard is met, an approval is granted to work for Cargill Kitchen Solutions.  Before work is started all contractors complete an orientation to ensure understanding of Cargill Kitchen Solutions safety policies/rules and permit procedures.  

Cargill Kitchen Solutions Monticello, MN has had no reportable releases in the last five years.   

We prevent accidents by designing for safety, maintaining our plant, operating safely, auditing our safety systems and training of stakeholders.  To ensure continous improvement , the environment, health, and safety function has increased staff resources.  We have contracted with consultants' to assist us in revalidaiton of PHA's and to conduct compliance audits on an ongoing basis.  

We continuously review industry practices and benchmark for applicable best practices to improve our ammonia system to make it safer for our stakeholders and the surrounding community.
